Description: Lower part of a pale green glazed composition wadj papyrus-column amulet.
Curator's comments: W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 75 § 72 : "A large number of blue-glazed amulets, beads, &c., were found in the camp, and a selection of these will be kept together in the British Museum to show the style of known work of the twenty-sixth dynasty".
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.60, p.180, pl.22)
Condition: fair - upper part with capital broken away
